snippet: In agreeing with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to turn over a share of their slot revenues, the Senecas’ three casinos would get exclusive territorial rights.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and Seneca Nations of Indians announce settlement of bitter dispute over gambling revenues; cities of Buffalo, Salamanca and Niagara Falls will get a combined $140 million, entire amount owed them since 2009, and Cuomo's plan to legalize up to 7 more casinos may gain momentum; agreement  brings to an end longstanding source of tense relations with tribes operating casinos in state.
lead_paragraph: In agreeing with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to turn over a share of their slot revenues, the Senecas’ three casinos would get exclusive territorial rights.

headline.main: Seneca Tribe Reaches Deal With Cuomo on Gambling
headline.print_headline: Seneca Tribe Reaches Deal With Cuomo On Gambling
